channel.title: People under communism
channel.description:
A series of documentaries, interviews and talks based upon documented evidence and expert knowledge about the power and intentions of the Soviet Union.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: National self-determination
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Philip E. Mosely of Columbia University: "National Self-Determination: Soviet Style".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Strange behavior of the Soviet diplomats, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a talk by Professor Philip E. Mosely of Columbia University: "The Strange Behavior of the Soviet Diplomats".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part two
item.description: Part two of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Driscoll, David
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Loyalty of the Soviet people
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Merle Fainsod of Harvard University: "The Loyalty of the Soviet People".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part one
item.description: Part one of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Driscoll, David
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Russian revolutionary movement
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Merle Fainsod of Harvard University: "Russian Revolutionary Movement and the Rise of Bolshevism".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Men who make the MiGs, part one
item.description: Part one of the third episode in this series, dramatizes flaws in the Soviet system, as well as the pressures that Soviet citizens are under in order to get by professionally and personally.
item.dc:creator: Tangney, Ralph J.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Music and the dream, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, dramatizes the struggle between the U.S. and Soviet Union over controlling Asia's emerging revolutionary path.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Literature to order, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts, takes a look at Soviet literature and its impact.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Through the Iron Curtain
item.description: A documentary by the British Broadcasting Corporation about life in communist countries. It is the final program in the "People Under Communism" series.
item.dc:creator: Esslin, Martin, 1918-2002
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part one
item.description: Part one of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Driscoll, David
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Music to order, part one
item.description: In the first part of this episode, the panel discusses music in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Communism in China
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Harold Fisher of Stanford University: "Communism in China". Fisher also speaks with Robert C. North.
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Literature to order, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, takes a look at Soviet literature and its impact.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Pattern of world conflict, part 1 of 2
item.description: This episode discusses how relations between former allies in World War 2 deteriorated and led to the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Music to order, part two
item.description: In the second part of this episode, the panel discusses music in the Soviet Union, including the music of Sergei Prokofiev, Igor Stravinsky, and Peter Ilich Tchaikovsky.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The men who make the Migs, part 2 of 2
item.description: Part two of the third episode in this series, dramatizes flaws in the Soviet system, as well as the pressures that Soviet citizens are under in order to get by professionally and personally.
item.dc:creator: Tangney, Ralph J.
item.dc:subject: World Politics
